intro: Fimbristylis marrana, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that contain tiny flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist to waterlogged soils. Fimbristylis marrana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
